alert.note: Alert for Benton; Cedar; Iowa; Johnson; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:23AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Cedar, Johnson, southeastern Benton, southern Linn and east central Iowa Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 423 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Atkins to near Amana to near Williamsburg. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, West Branch, Coralville, North Liberty, Mount Vernon, Lisbon, Fairfax, Solon, Tiffin, Ely, Walford, University Heights, Swisher, Oxford, Hills, Shueyville, Bertram, Oakdale and Lake Macbride State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 229 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
